comments.body: not needed here, but it's worth knowing that hadoop-common-test jar has a class `org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystemTestHelper` that lets you inject an instance of an FS into the cache. Very useful from time to time. Spark could either use that  or add its own (test module) class to o.a.h.fs and call `FileSystem.addFileSystemForTesting()` when needed
Thanks for the guidance, let me check the usage of FileSystemTestHelper.
Talked with @jose-torres offline. The ordering of result here is not guaranteed. Add `orderBy` to fix the test case.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +278,282 @@            "CAST(end as BIGINT) AS end",
            "count")
          .orderBy("start") // sort the DataFrame in order to compare with the expected one.
        checkDataset(
          outputDf.as[(Long, Long, Long)],
